entry.title: The Continuing Threat of Unpatched Security Vulnerabilities
entry.summary: Unpatched software is a computer code containing known security weaknesses. Software vendors write additions to the codes, known as "patches," when they come to know about these application vulnerabilities to secure these weaknesses. Adversaries
